message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("input.txt"));
        String line;
        int w = 0;
        int[][] tab = new int[10][10]; // assuming the size is 10x10
        while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
            StringTokenizer stringTokenizer = new StringTokenizer(line, " ");
            while (stringTokenizer.hasMoreTokens()) {
                Integer k = Integer.parseInt(stringTokenizer.nextToken());
                tab[w][k - 1] = 1;
            }
            w++;
        }
        br.close();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code reads the file line by line using BufferedReader. For each line, it creates a StringTokenizer to split the line into tokens using space as the delimiter. It then parses each token into an integer and uses it to update the 2D array 'tab'. After processing all tokens in a line, it increments the variable 'w' to move to the next row in the array. This process continues until all lines in the file have been read.
